column4: I can't get into a terminal by pressing Ctrl+Alt+F1, how can I fix that?
in what context are you experiencing this problem?
so X has failed and you are without a gui?
hmmm..I wonder whether unistalling xgl has taken your vterms with it
Actually now that I think about it I couldn't get into a vterm when I had XGL installed.
do you think you might be able to get to recovery mode?
Until I crashed X by uninstalling it and had no other way to login  :)
Recovery mode? Off the boot cd?
usually through the grub menu choices
I probably can
there is usually a kernel option with '(recovery mode)' written after it
it will drop you to a root prompt
Okay, what will I need to do from there?
attempt to reinstall the drivers
or reconfigure xorg to use vesa drivers or something like that
Okay, well do you think that it's a possibility that the key shortcuts have been modified and that's why I can't get into a vterm?
quite possible I suppose, but I couldnt say with any certitude
Cause it's kind of strange that Alt+left arrow key doesn't work anymore in firefox to go back a page
Is there a way to adjust the key shortcuts like that?  I didn't see anything under System -> Preferences -> Keyboard Shortcuts
Thanks for the help, I'll reinstall those drivers and call it good.
Thanks, recovery mode worked perfect now I'm going to configure xorg.conf to work with both my video cards.
good luck :)
I'm excited  :)
make a backup of your working xorg.conf ;)
